segments.source_content: **[Why We're Breaking Up with CSS-in-JS](https://dev.to/srmagura/why-were-breaking-up-wiht-css-in-js-4g9b)**

translations.zh-hant: **[我們為何放棄 CSS-in-JS](https://dev.to/srmagura/why-were-breaking-up-wiht-css-in-js-4g9b)**

segments.source_content: Sam is a maintainer of Emotion, one of the most popular CSS-in-JS libs. He explains the advantages and disadvantages of CSS-in-JS, with a focus on runtime libraries problems. For his company Spot, the cost of serializing styles was too high. They replaced Emotion by Sass modules (CSS modules + Sass) with a CSS utility system. On Docusaurus, we use CSS modules and I confirm that it is a good no-runtime and relatively simple alternative. DX is not as good but still quite acceptable.

translations.zh-hant: Sam 是熱門 CSS-in-JS 函式庫 Emotion 的維護者。他剖析 CSS-in-JS 的優缺點，特別聚焦運行時函式庫的問題。對其公司 Spot 而言，樣式序列化的成本過高，因此改用 Sass modules (CSS modules + Sass) 搭配 CSS 工具系統。在 Docusaurus 專案中，我們也使用 CSS modules，確認這是無運行時且相對簡單的替代方案。開發體驗雖不如 CSS-in-JS，但仍相當可接受。

segments.source_content: This article has started many interesting discussions. It has been known for a while that CSS-in-JS libraries with runtime cause performance problems. [Dan Abramov confirms](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1584835028986793984) and [does not want to use any runtime on the new React doc site](https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/5115). Ryan Florence mentions [performance problems with Chakra](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1582835729360572416), which uses Emotion.

translations.zh-hant: 此文引發諸多討論。CSS-in-JS 運行時函式庫會導致效能問題已是公開秘密。[Dan Abramov 證實此點](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1584835028986793984)，並表示[新版 React 官網不會採用任何運行時方案](https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/5115)。Ryan Florence 也提到[使用 Emotion 的 Chakra 有效能問題](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1582835729360572416)。

segments.source_content: Tailwind remains a good alternative. For me, it can be put in the CSS-in-JS no-runtime category, especially in a React context where Tailwind styling is done via JSX. Some question its [maintainability](https://twitter.com/hi__mayank/status/1584261503670448128), but in practice it works quite well.

translations.zh-hant: Tailwind 仍然是個不錯的替代方案。對我而言，它可以歸類為無運行時（no-runtime）的 CSS-in-JS 解決方案，特別是在 React 環境中，Tailwind 樣式是透過 JSX 實現的。有人質疑其[可維護性](https://twitter.com/hi__mayank/status/1584261503670448128)，但在實際應用中表現相當出色。

segments.source_content: **[Qwik React](https://qwik.builder.io/qwikcity/integrations/react/)**

translations.zh-hant: **[Qwik React](https://qwik.builder.io/qwikcity/integrations/react/)**

segments.source_content: Qwik is an innovative SPA framework that [avoids performance issues related to client-side hydration](https://www.builder.io/blog/hydration-is-pure-overhead). It can now integrate with React through a `qwikify$()` function to wrap any existing React component. `client:` directives (inspired by Astro) allow to control when the React component will be hydrated with a lot of granularity. The demo integrates Material UI in a Qwik app. See also [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLH28rDu97I). I think it's a good solution to avoid doing an all-in on this new framework, and try it gradually. We can also keep the cross-platform properties of React, while adopting Qwik to improve performance on the web.

translations.zh-hant: Qwik 是一個創新的 SPA 框架，[能避免與客戶端水合（client-side hydration）相關的效能問題](https://www.builder.io/blog/hydration-is-pure-overhead)。現在它可透過 `qwikify$()` 函數整合 React，用於封裝任何現有的 React 元件。`client:` 指令（靈感來自 Astro）能精細控制 React 元件的水合時機。演示中將 Material UI 整合至 Qwik 應用，詳見[此影片](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fLH28rDu97I)。此方案能避免全面採用新框架的風險，逐步嘗試 Qwik 以提升網頁效能，同時保留 React 的跨平台特性。

segments.source_content: **[Fully Typed Web Apps](https://www.epicweb.dev/fully-typed-web-apps)**

translations.zh-hant: **[完全類型化的網頁應用](https://www.epicweb.dev/fully-typed-web-apps)**

segments.source_content: Kent C. Dodds explains the interest of having end to end type-safety, from the DB to the UI, through the different boundaries: network, localstorage, DB... He talks about validation (schema, type guards), type generation (Prisma) and conventions (Remix). He explains how this experience is possible with Remix, thanks to inference: it is better to use `typeof` than `as`.

translations.zh-hant: Kent C. Dodds 闡述端到端類型安全（end to end type-safety）的價值——從資料庫到 UI，貫穿網路、本地儲存、資料庫等邊界。他探討驗證（結構描述、類型守衛）、類型生成（Prisma）與約定（Remix），並說明 Remix 如何透過型別推論實現此體驗：使用 `typeof` 比 `as` 更佳。

segments.source_content: **[Building an interactive WebGL experience in Next.js](https://vercel.com/blog/building-an-interactive-webgl-experience-in-next-js)**

translations.zh-hant: **[在 Next.js 中建構互動式 WebGL 體驗](https://vercel.com/blog/building-an-interactive-webgl-experience-in-next-js)**

segments.source_content: Vercel explains how they created an [impressive immersive signup experience for the Next.js conf](https://nextjs.org/conf), based on React-Three-Fiber. It's still complex to understand without 3D / WebGL / Three.js experience, but the deconstruction in successive steps is interesting and gives an insight into the mindset of doing creative dev.

translations.zh-hant: Vercel 解析如何為 [Next.js 大會打造沉浸式註冊體驗](https://nextjs.org/conf)，該體驗基於 React-Three-Fiber 實現。儘管缺乏 3D/WebGL/Three.js 經驗者理解仍具挑戰性，但其分階段解構的方法展現了創意開發的思維模式。

segments.source_content:
- 👀 [React Cache API Pull-Request](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/25506): exposes a new `React.experimental_cache` API
- 📖 [New beta doc - cloneElement](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1582814754426433537)
- 📦 [Vitest Preview](https://www.vitest-preview.com/): permits to visually debug Vitest tests. Little brother of [Jest Preview](https://www.jest-preview.com/).
- 📦 [Outstatic - A static CMS for Next.js](https://outstatic.com/): new Git-based CMS that integrates nicely with Next.js. Simple user-friendly editor with the ability to upload images.
- 📜 [Netlify - Background and Scheduled API Routes for Next.js](https://www.netlify.com/blog/new-background-scheduled-api-routes-nextjs/): Netlify using its background functions to call Next.js API based on cron expressions.
- 📜 [Cloudflare Pages support for Next.js Edge Runtime](https://blog.cloudflare.com/next-on-pages/): Cloudflare now supports Next.js, only via the `experimental-edge` runtime that can run on Cloudflare Workers (unlike the Node.js runtime). Their solution is based on [Vercel Build Output API](https://vercel.com/blog/build-output-api), which seems to pave the way for better portability of edge-first frameworks between different clouds.
- 📜 [Microsoft - Extending Next.js support in Azure Static Web Apps](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/apps-on-azure-blog/extending-next-js-support-in-azure-static-web-apps/ba-p/3627975): Azure will now support Next.js SSR (previously: only SSG).
- 📜 [Persist inputs after a form submit in Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/persist-inputs-after-a-form-submit-in-remix): proposes a progressive enhancement solution to keep the values of a form after a submission. 2 solutions: return the values in the Remix action or use the flash session.
- 📜 [Currying Layout Component Patterns in Next.js](https://creativedesignsguru.com/currying-nextjs-layout/): suggest to parametrize the `getLayout` of Next.js to create Layout variants without leading to unmount/remount. Nice trick today, might become less relevant with the upcoming nested layouts support.
- 📜 [Throwing vs. Returning responses in Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/throwing-vs-returning-responses-in-remix)
- 📜 [Lessons learned from moving to Recoil.js](https://kitemaker.co/blog/lessons-learned-from-moving-to-recoil)
- 📜 [Separate API Layers In React Apps](https://profy.dev/article/react-architecture-api-layer)
- 🎥 [Is the new React use hook a footgun?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ytXM05PVcFU)
- 🎥 [React Advanced London 2022 - Day 1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1x7mI_xuVVo)
- 🧵 [Lottie vs Rive](https://twitter.com/guidorosso/status/1582086637328031745): Lottie is quite popular in the React ecosystem but its competitor Rive looks much more performant at runtime.
- 🐦 [Zustand code in a tweet](https://twitter.com/dai_shi/status/1583082766081531905)
- 🔗 [New website for Storybook](https://twitter.com/storybookjs/status/1583175829009289216)
